title: Full-Stack Software Engineer - UST Global Inc - Full-time Contractor
description: Client-side contract work as a Software Engineer for a Fortune 500 healthcare company designing and developing a natural language search engine for a client’s medical benefits along with internal tools to aid in creating a health domain ontology for understanding the intent of a user.

roles.title: Full-Stack Developer for client search engine API and internal applications and testing
responsibilities: Worked on a health benefit search engine from the project’s conception, centered around Stanford’s Core NLP Engine.

Collaborated with project managers as the main UI developer to design and create internal applications to manage data and validate systems using Angular 6+ as the front-end, Java 8 as the back-end, and MongoDB and Oracle SQL for data storage.

Utilized Spring Boot and other java libraries such as Spring JPA and Hibernate to rapidly develop scalable RESTful APIs, and developed a simple security package using Spring AOP to allow APIs in a microservice architecture to safely interface with user applications.
Deployed applications in a bare metal Linux environment manually during the POC phase before eventually migrating applications to a CI/CD Docker environment in production.

roles.title: ML/NLP Systems Engineer for improving client search engine
responsibilities: Designed an in-house machine learning system to replace and improve beyond the initial Stanford solution.
Developed a machine learning model for understanding text at the word level, utilizing Python libraries such as FastText and Gensim to create a natural language ontology.
Created a natural language multi-intent model using Tensorflow to assist the search engine in understanding a user’s search intent.
Furthered the machine learning system’s understanding through entity recognition using CRF++ and NLTK.
Implemented an automated system for training and deploying machine learning models using Flask and the Advanced Python Scheduler.
